definition: labor camp/prison camp with hard labor
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Is it true that conditions in our labor campsare excellent?
sentences.chinese: 我們勞動營的條件真的是很棒嗎？

sentences.english: More than a million civilians were sent to labour camps to be worked or starved to death.
sentences.chinese: 超過一百萬平民被送至勞動營工作或者餓死。
